jobsJson.descriptionPlain:
Gojek Design Team consists of 60 people in Design, and we’re spread across two countries and 5 teams namely, Communication Design, Writing, Design Operations, Interaction Design and Product Design.

Gojek Design Team works very closely with different functions and products in the organisation, and we go to great lengths to make sure we deliver a world-class experience to our millions of users. 

Gojek’s Design Team is looking for a creative designer rooted in visual design but also experienced in branding or UI/UX. You will be responsible for designing and maintaining Gojek brands and its products, supporting product team needs, collaborate with other creatives such as illustrator, writer, photographer and not limited to other team from different stream.

jobsJson.additionalPlain:
Gojek is a technology startup based in Jakarta, Indonesia. Specialising in ride-hailing and logistics, we are also the only company in Southeast Asia to be part of Fortune's 50 Companies That Changed the World (2017).

Gojek is a Super App: one app with over 20 services including food delivery, commuting, digital payments, shopping, hyper-local delivery, massages, and many more.

Gojek is Indonesia’s first and fastest growing unicorn building an on-demand empire. Our total of 2,000,000 driver-partners collectively travel 16.5 million KM daily – making us Indonesia’s de-facto transportation choice.

Gojek is a verb! Gojek is a way of life!

lists.content:
• Work closely with product owners to define branding for our family of products
  • Understand international branding aspects, and work towards improving the overall brand experience
  • Puzzling out users and markets, defining brand guidelines, and implementing the visual style guide across teams
  • Provide creative assets, as well as implement to visual output
  • Control in-app creative content, from each asset’s guideline creation and distribution, to visual content review
  • Work closely with interaction and product designers to implement brand elements across products
  • Research present trends in graphic design, and implement them in the Gojek brand guideline
  • Identify shortfalls and opportunities in our existing brand communication by improving the current brand guidelines
  • Handle multiple projects at a time, and prioritise some, based on the ever-evolving business needs

• Strong understanding of graphic design fundamentals such as colors, typography, composition, and design principles.
  • Strong understanding of brand systems, and creating guidelines.
  • Strong aesthetic sense of visual design and art directing skills: broad taste and good sense of composition
  • Attention to detail in all medium
  • Willing to explore different techniques
  • Knowledge in UI/UX is a plus
